title: Android Weekly Issue #629
description: Articles & Tutorials Sponsored Microsoft Clarity SDK: see what your app users see Gain invaluable insights into how users are using your app with detailed heatmaps and session recordings. Trusted by thousands of companies, Clarity SDK helps you enhance user experience, and drive growth, all while maintaining user privacy and with minimal impact on your app. And it’s 100% FREE! Kotlin Flows — Fundamentals Anitaa Murthy continues a series on Kotlin Coroutines, this time examining Kotlin Flows. Mastering SDUI: A Deep Dive into Server-Driven UI Anupam Singh considers what Server-Driven UI is and how to use it in building an app. Best Firebase Tools for Your Mobile Application Jaewoong Eum shows how to utilize Firebase for your mobile and web applications, covering features such as authentication, push notifications, remote config, analytics, and more. Exploring the Viability of Cross-Platform UI Development with Compose Multiplatform Kwabena Bio Berko considers the power of Compose Multiplatform in delivering native UI experiences across platforms. Migrating from Play Core Library You may have received an email from Google Play Store recently stating that an update to your Play Core Maven dependency is needed. This article shows how easy it is to handle. Now in Android #108 Ash Nohe covers Android 15 Beta 3, two Compose case studies, Google AI Studio, Gemini in Android Studio, and lots of stable AndroidX releases. The Little Things: Confusing error messages This series by Annyce Davis is dedicated to the little things in programming that make you want to bang your head against the wall. This post is about: confusing error messages. Local or Remote? How you add your KMP framework matters Kevin Schildhorn considers the question "Do you actually need to use SPM or Cocoapods to include KMP?" You don't, and it might not be the right answer. Create a Compose Multiplatform app — tutorial In this JetBrains tutorial, you will build a sample application that runs on Android, iOS, and desktop. Place a sponsored post Advertise your Android dev course to over 80k readers We reach out to more than 80k Android developers around the world, every week, through our email newsletter and social media channels. Advertise your Android development course! Libraries & Code LuckyWheelView A custom lightweight component that displays a Lucky Wheel developed with Kotlin. kotlinx-rpc Add asynchronous RPC services to your Kotlin multiplatform applications Dropdown A Powerful and customizable Compose Multiplatform dropdown menu with cascade and animations. Videos & Podcasts Droidcon Italy 2023 All the presentations from Droidcon Italy 2023 7 Features in Kotlin's Standard Library that You Might Have Overlooked Dave Leeds covers seven features in Kotlin's standard library that you might have missed or forgotten about. Ultimate Guide on Synchronized Concurrency and Thread-safety with Kotlin Mutex Stevdza-San shares the ultimate guide on Synchronized Concurrency and Thread-safety with Kotlin Mutex. Maintain consistency in your Kotlin Codebase with Konsist! Charfaoui Younes explores the world of Static Code Analyzers with an easy-to-use library called Konsist which helps you ensure the consistency of your codebase! How to Share Resources in Compose Multiplatform - KMP for Beginners Philipp Lackner shows how to share resources in Compose Multiplatform! Android 15 Beta 3, Google AI Studio, Gemini in Android Studio, and more! Learn about Android 15 Beta 3, two Compose case studies, Google AI Studio, Gemini in Android Studio, and lots of stable AndroidX releases. Exploring Android App Performance with Rahul Ravikumar! Dive into the latest episode where the Coding Italians craft a system for instrumenting method calls to enhance Android app performance. Learn how to use ASM, the Byte Code Viewer plugin, and JVM bytecode specifications to generate insightful Perfetto traces. Adaptive List-Detail Layout using Jetpack Compose Daniel Atitienei shows how to adapt your layout for all devices using the list detail layout.
